hook.text: When GameStop stock surged 1,600% in 2021, millions rushed to buy. Most lost money.

buildup.text: Herd mentality means following the crowd, assuming the group must know something you don't.

discovery.text: Herding feels safe. If everyone else is buying, surely it can't be a bad idea.

twist.text: But crowds create bubbles and crashes. The herd rushes in together and then stampedes out together.

climax.text: Contrarian investors profit by going against the herd â€” buying fear and selling euphoria.

punchline.text: Following the crowd is comforting but costly.

quiz.question: What is herd mentality in investing?
